Add/Replace/Delete.Description: These modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute in the definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Copy Object.Description: This attribute is used to copy values of objects from the source object context into the target object context.

Parameters.Keywords: Direct Methods Only, Dir Methods Only, Full, Primary Methods Only

Copy Object.Name: Copy Object

Delete Collection Object.Description: This attribute helps to delete the objects of the collection based on the index and condition given.
Delete Collection Object.Name: Delete Collection Object

Insert Collection Object.Description: This attribute is used to insert the new object inside the sub-collection
Insert Collection Object.Name: Insert Collection Object

Local Formula.Description: This attribute is used to specify a local formula within the Object Map.
Local Formula.Name: Local Formula

Object Map.Description: This attribute is used to call another object map definition.
Object Map.Name: Object Map

Repeat.Description: This attribute is used to walk over the collection and to perform mappings, the Object Map Name specified here is repeated over the specified collection.
Repeat.Name: Repeat

Reset Values.Description: This attribute is used to reset the value of storage based on the condition given.
Reset Values.Name: Reset Values

Set.Description: This attribute is used to initialize and set value for the storages of the target object.
Set.Name: Set

Set Direct Values.Description: This attribute is used when we have to set the storage value from the source object to the target object.
Set Direct Values.Name: Set Direct Values

Set Multi Values.Description: This attribute is used to initialize and set values for the multiple methods of the target object which have the same name.
Set Multi Values.Name: Set Multi Values

Set Var.Description: This attribute is used to set the values to a variable conditionally.
Set Var.Name: Set Var

Source Object.Description: This attribute is used to for setting the primary or sub-object as the source object using method formula syntax.
Source Object.Name: Source Object

Target Object.Description: This attribute is used to for setting the primary or sub-object as the target object using method formula syntax.
Target Object.Name: Target Object

Target Object Ex.Description: This attribute is used for setting the sub-object as target object from a sub-collection, based on a condition. If object is not found, it will insert an object in the collection and set it as the target.
Target Object Ex.Name: Target Object Ex

Use.Description: This keyword is used as a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Variable.Description: This attribute is used to declare the variables at the Object Map level.
Variable.Name: Variable
